title: Authors and Citation
text: Minh-Anh Huynh. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Huynh M (2022). RStudioBackupPrefs: Easily backup RStudio preferences easily import another computer github. https://github.com/Minh-AnhHuynh/RStudioBackupPrefs, https://minh-anhhuynh.github.io/RStudioBackupPrefs/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {RStudioBackupPrefs: Easily backup your RStudio preferences easily and import them on another computer from github},   author = {Minh-Anh Huynh},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/Minh-AnhHuynh/RStudioBackupPrefs, https://minh-anhhuynh.github.io/RStudioBackupPrefs/}, }

what: Easily backup your RStudio preferences easily and import them on another computer from github
title: Easily backup your RStudio preferences easily and import them on another computer from github
text: goal RStudioBackupPrefs provide easy online way backup restore R Studio preferences. reference, following files backed : addins.json rstudio_bindings.json rstudio-prefs.json r.snippets Credits pat-s/rstudioSettings idea getting inspiration backup code.

title: Easily backup your RStudio preferences easily and import them on another computer from github
text: can install development version RStudioBackupPrefs GitHub : Additionally fond librarian package, can install package :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("Minh-AnhHuynh/RStudioBackupPrefs") # install.packages("librarian")   # librarian::shelf() will install or load the package if already installed. # You can queue up multiple package in one line.  librarian::shelf(Minh-AnhHuynh/RStudioBackupPrefs)

title: Easily backup your RStudio preferences easily and import them on another computer from github
text: basic example shows use package: use GitHub functionalities, need initiated repository. Simply initiate one :
code: # Backup your preferences library(RStudioBackupPrefs) start_backup_prefs(github_backup = TRUE)   # Import your preferences start_import_prefs(pull_github = TRUE, clone_git = FALSE)  # Use clone_git = TRUE for first time usage start_import_prefs(clone_git = TRUE) # Assuming you're in a repository: usethis::use_git() usethis::use_github()  # Optional: usethis::git_vaccinate()  # Set your credentials if needed: gitcreds::gitcreds_set()  # Make sure to put your user.name and user.email in global config

title: Copy backup files to a chosen local folder — copy_files_to_local
code: copy_files_to_local() #> ✔ Preferences files copied to #> /home/runner/work/RStudioBackupPrefs/RStudioBackupPrefs/rstudio_preferences//addins.json, #> /home/runner/work/RStudioBackupPrefs/RStudioBackupPrefs/rstudio_preferences//rstudio-prefs.json, #> and #> /home/runner/work/RStudioBackupPrefs/RStudioBackupPrefs/rstudio_preferences//rstudio_bindings.json
